data.title: Deleted model files do not get removed out of .mis file.
data.body:
If you place a model into your scene, for example the cube model, save the mission, exit Torque and then delete the "cube" under the art/shapes folder manually and then launch the game again, you will see in the mission list the cube is gone, but if you open the .mis file with a code editor you will notice the "TSStatic" with the cube model is still there.
A good solution would be if the engine would give an error message and/or just delete the entries for the models where the files have been moved or deleted.

"cursor is displayed only if the display count is greater than or equal to 0"

data.title: dds files with dxt5 compression broken for terrain textures with parallax
data.body:
Parallax uses the height information that has to be put into the alpha channel of the texture, then problem is if you want to convert it to the .dds format, you need to chose dxt5 compression then, since it is the only compression, that stores the alpha channel sufficiently.
This is a reminder of an issue posted on the forum some time ago:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/135776

data.title: Fix GuiShapeNameHud maths
data.body: Compare cosines, not cosine/angle. See #1009.

data.title: Fix a crash when change a material reclect cubemap
data.body: Replaces #1031

data.title: Fix a crash when change a material reflect cubemap.
data.body:
Fix for  #694 Cubemap R6025 

This is the problem of allow pointers and smart pointers on same code.

What happens:
- We have a pointer to object
- We assign pointer to StrongPtr
- Bla, bla bla bla...
- Clean StrongPointer -> 0 refs -> delete object... oh no!!! :(
- We use our first pointer... pointing to a deleted object :(

data.title: minLookAngle maxLookAngle inverted?
data.body:
as part of the research into https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/945 looked into:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/afef3268a76c14905c18d80c77788fe0e06e8a68/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/player.cs#L509-L510 and https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/3082bb3adc75134dc4cba2e1787b8ec838771ed5/Engine/source/T3D/player.cpp#L269-L270 and found that minLookAngle is actually the variable which constrains how high a first person player can point. may be addressed by the fix in that issue as well, or may be separate.

data.body: Fixes issue #976 by deferring the stack reset until the next root execution of script. Also adds code to ensure the initial string stack buffer is blank, preventing an issue with the terminal debugger code execution.

Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: Includes #892 with tweaks. In comparison to that PR, I inverted the use of the `#define` so that it defaults to the old behaviour, and adding a define enables the new. This plays nicer with existing projects and the current CI setup (which needs to be fixed).

data.title: Fix weapon image camera shake
data.body: Previous functionality was broken as reported in #1016. Now it works, and the camera shake is seen by non-control objects. Hopefully doesn't crash either. Tested with local multiplayer. Includes example config for the Ryder.

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body:
This contains #908, with tweaks so I'm satisfied with the code.
- Removed the `#define`s
- Made it fall back to using visible distance if ghost distance is not used
- Removed ghost distance from level files as it will now default sensibly
- Renamed `mConnectionVisibleDistance` for consistency
- Fixed tabs

data.title: AIPlayer trigger fix as in #1007
data.body: Check against the right constant, and use an unsigned int for looping.

data.title: Camera shake weapon recoil crashes the client
data.body:
If you activate camera shake when firing and start a game with other human players after some shooting the game crashes for both.
You can find this function for example in Lurker.cs line 646-649
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/art/datablocks/weapons/Lurker.cs

There is no error report, but it seems to have something to do with the camera position, things like jumping and shooting seem to trigger this crash, when there are multiple functions trying to get camera positions.
In console the command: "trace(1)" can be used to log the point where it crashes, since there is no error in the regular log.

data.title: Fix APlayer::singleShot
data.body: Look for datablock's `shootingDelay` property instead of the object's, and provide a default of 1s to prevent infinite loops.
